intro: Deuterocohnia meziana subsp. meziana, commonly known as the Mexican cushion fern, is a compact, mat-forming plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Polypodiaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, fiddlehead-like fronds. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Its rhizomes are short and thick, anchoring it to rocky or soil substrates. The fronds are typically evergreen, with a leathery texture and a distinctive, curling appearance.
